result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lavan Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Lavan Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Lavan Robinson was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to sign up for probation prior to release from custody.
- Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
- 13 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 Court Costs. Reduced to a civil judgment.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Reduced to a civil judgment.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
- Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

cc: DA & DE Atty

Case recalled - 10:14 AM  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel. ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  David Lavan Robinson appeared from jail.  Atty Selmer has had time to go over rights with DE and complete plea questionnaire. DE maintins his NC plea to Ct 1 made when case initially called. Court questions Defendant under oath.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct 1 due to NC plea. On the State's Motion, Court dismisses Ct 2. State is in compliance with victims rights, no restitution claims were made. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders Ct 1:  S/W 1 year  probation with conditions:    
-13 days credit upon ultimate sentence
- Court Costs:   $243.00; converted to a civil jmt 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00; converted to a civil jmt
- AODA within 30 Days
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Probation to come over today to get DE signed up prior to his release today
-Authorized to have probation transferred to MN 

Adjourned:  10:34 am

09:41 AM  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA: Erica Ellenwood w/Intern M. Connor Smith    DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  David Lavan Robinson appeared from jail.  Atty Ellenwood notes a resolution and states on record which will be plea  to Ct 1 which does not need a PH. Atty Selmer agrees. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads  NC to Ct 1.  Atty Selmer states he has not had time to discuss this plea with his client as to the constitutional rights he is giving up with his plea. Court questions DE, if  he would like to reset the matter to a later time. DE would like more time court resets  to 10:15 am.  Adjourned:   9:45 am
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:02 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur.   ADA:  Michelle P Brekken     DF:  David Lavan Robinson appeared from jail. Set for Preliminary Hearing. Court advises Defendant that PD has appointed Atty Selmer for him, but wasn't available for today's hearing. Court finds good cause to go beyond time limits. Attys to schedule prelim with JA for next week. Adjourned at 10:04 AM.  gll

to reschedule PH hearing  on 05/27/22. Filed by Atty Statorius. arc   e: DA    Per SRN, DE to be brought up, DA can cancel witness, Court to make finding to extend time limits. JA advise DA's Office. arc
filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Selmer. arc
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:48 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF: David Lavan Robinson appeared from jail, pro se.  Travis Satorius is in person but has a conflict and cannot represent DE.  Set for PH. Court informs DE the PD's office is looking for an Atty to represent him. Court finds good cause to continue the prelim.  Adjourned at 8:57 AM. bph  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jon W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Pre signed waiver of extradition

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
